DOCNAME: CASE OF ŞENOL ULUSLARARASI NAKLİYAT, İHRACAT VE TİCARET LİMİTED ŞİRKETİ v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company is a NORP company specialising in international highway transportation .

CARDINAL . On DATE at GPE port the NORP police discovered QUANTITY of heroin stashed in a lorry which had been hired by the applicant company for the purpose of transporting walnut logs from GPE to GPE . The driver of the vehicle escaped . As soon as they found out about the incident the applicant company informed ORG and submitted all the documents in their possession concerning the transportation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company ’s licence for international highway transportation was extended until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) revoked the applicant company ’s licence pursuant to LAW , on account of the incident in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company brought an action before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) and requested the annulment of the ORG ’s decision of DATE . It also requested ORG to grant an interim decision to suspend the execution of the ORG ’s decision .

CARDINAL . The Ministry submitted written defence arguments , together with a number of supporting documents , to ORG on DATE . ORG forwarded the ORG ’s written defence arguments to the applicant company . The documents attached to the ORG ’s written defence arguments , however , were not forwarded to the applicant company but were placed in the case file of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted observations in response to those of the Ministry . In their observations the lawyers for the applicant company referred to a number of documents which had been appended to the ORG ’s written defence arguments of CARDINAL DATE but which had not been communicated to them .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company ’s request for the interim measure was refused by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the case . In the proceedings the applicant company had submitted that the drug trafficking had been carried out by the driver of the hired vehicle and that the company could not , therefore , be held responsible for the driver ’s actions . In its decision ORG held , inter alia , that since the impugned transportation had been undertaken by the applicant company under its licence , it was responsible for the transportation and therefore the ORG had acted lawfully when revoking the licence .
CARDINAL . An appeal lodged by the applicant company on CARDINAL DATE was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant company ’s request of DATE for a rectification of the decision . That decision was served on the applicant company on DATE .
